title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - Patch 7.13
body:
https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/na_images/PCHCHT/Minions.jpg
Header by inkiness

Hey, everyone! I'm Riot King Cobra and it's time for another round of Patch Chat! These threads serve as opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks. You can find the most recent patch by following this link: [Patch 7.13 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-713-notes).

I'm on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun. Ask us questions - we'll try to answer as many as we can!

Patch 7.13 brings about the new Honor system! We also toned down Galio a bit, gave Gnar, Poppy, Maokai, and Rek'Sai some love, and made adjustments to a number of other champions like Kindred, Shaco, and Kha'Zix. This patch also contains a newly reworked Abyssal Mask and a buffed up Adaptive Helm! 

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players!

Ben “Cezium” Burkhardt
Don “Aesah” Ding
Dan “penguin” Hardison
Robert “ROBERTxLEE” Lee
Rob "King Cobra" Rosa
Nicholas “Nickwu” Smith
Blake “S0be” Soberanis
Trevor “ThEntropist” Thernes
Arnor "Hjarta" Halldorsson
Brian "Madness Heroo" Pressoir

Hi there,
What's your opinion on Malzahar? Some people found frustrating the lack of counterplay against his flash+ult combo. He has point-and-click poke with E, his voidlings are ruining all possible Malz chasing with that damage, and Q has stupidly short CD for an AOE silence. Lane phase is extremely save with passive and huge waveclear.
His winrate is about 54-55%.

I'm relatively happy with Malz right now. He is certainly on the strong side for solo-q but he's seeing only niche play in competitive, and I think he does have demonstrable weaknesses, particularly early game. I think a champion with the profile of Malzahar Mid (weak early, short/medium range for a mage, point and click hard CC) is probably always going to be stronger in Solo Q than competitive, so we likely have to accept him sitting at a fairly high winrate if we want him to be viable in pro play. 54-55 may be too high though.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotMadnessHeroo,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=AYUZulU3,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2017-06-28T02:44:46.369+0000)

I think a champion with the profile of Malzahar Mid (weak early, short/medium range for a mage, point and click hard CC) is probably always going to be stronger in Solo Q than competitive, so we likely have to accept him sitting at a fairly high winrate if we want him to be viable in pro play. 54-55 may be too high though.

Let's dig a little deeper on this. Is having any given champ be viable in competitive play so important that you're willing to accept outsized winrates in Solo Q, and if so why the hell haven't you guys buffed the shit out of Nasus already?

They did. The change to his ultimate a while back was a huge buff.

Nasus doesn't need buffs, he needs a small rework.

He's meant to be a lategame beast, but he can't reach that.

His passive and Q fall off because they don't do enough if the target has too much armor, and Nasus is too slow to reach anyone who isn't in the frontline.

His W scales wonderfully until 30 minutes, at which point it falls off a cliff because the guy he wants to use it on has QSS.

His E falls of in damage rather quickly, and its flat armor reduction isn't enough to keep him relevant.

His R has such high value that it's his best scaling ability, but it's not enough to keep the rest of this archaic mess afloat.
Are u really listing a point and click hard cc as a weakness ?

Hey guys, can I potentially ask about Kayn? What was it like playing him? Any transformation you thought were cooler over the other? Runes, masteries and builds?

I've had a lot of fun playing Kayn recently. He's a very unique champion in terms of both playstyle and strengths and weaknesses, and when you add in the 2 different forms to master I think he has an extremely high skill ceiling.

I personally find the Assassin thematic cooler but honestly playing both is a blast and a lot of my highlight moments have been on slayer due to the knockup on his W.

Runes are pretty flexible, I usually run AD reds and AS Quints but you can clear just fine with AD quints as well. While I haven't tried it myself I've been told Lethality feels fine as well.

I think Thunderlords is the go-to Keystone. You already have great target access, you just want as much burst potential/dueling power as possible for your early game. 

Builds can be tricky but I think there's a lot of room for experimentation. His damage scales well with the lethality items but if you go full glass cannon over things like Cleaver/GA I think the mechanical burden of playing the champion in teamfights rises significantly. Using your Ult well and finding the right engages with your E is absolutely crucial to avoid getting blown up with a squishier build, whereas things are a lot more forgiving with the bruiser builds. The damage payoff if you find the right engage and land all your abilities as the glass cannon build is substantial though.
